VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Show Fees and Charges in the Order Review Section of the Checkout Page

Provide a summary of the buyer's total expected cost before they provide their payment information. In the Order Review section of the Checkout page, you can calculate and show shipping fees, taxes, or other miscellaneous surcharges.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set
NOTE
Version 2.0 of the Order Review section of the Checkout page replaced the legacy version 1.0 in B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11). Version 2.0 provides the same user experience as version 1.0, but has faster data retrieval and quicker response times. For better performance, easier extension, and ongoing support, we recommend that new implementations always use version 2.0. If necessary for compatibility purposes, you can optionally re-enable version 1.0.
Version 2.0 of the Order Review section of the Checkout page is compatible only with version 2.0 of the Shopping Cart page.
Version 1.0 of the Order Review section of the Checkout page is compatible with both versions 2.0 and 1.0 of the Shopping Cart page.
Line-level independence (LLI) checkout is compatible with only version 1.0 of the Order Review section of the Checkout page.
When you enable Cart Scale in B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13), the Order Review section hides all product information by default. For more information, see Checkout with Cart Scale.

The following line items can appear in the Order Review section of the Checkout page for either standard checkout or LLI checkout:

Standard checkout:
The estimated shipping cost for the order (1), based on the selected shipping method.
The tax calculated for the order (not shown), based on the selected shipping address and applicable tax rates for the locality. You can set up simple tax calculations using the CC Tax Rate custom object, or integrate a comprehensive external tax service, such as Avalara.
A miscellaneous surcharge, other than shipping or tax, applied to the cart (2). B2B Commerce for Visualforce doesn't define any default behavior that sets this value. To apply this value to carts, you can extend classes of the B2B Commerce for Visualforce API.
LLI checkout:
The shipping amount for each shipping group (1), based on the group's selected shipping method.
The total estimated shipping cost for the entire order (2), based on the shipping amount for each shipping group.
NOTE
By default, the Order Review section for LLI checkout doesn't show a cart surcharge amount.
LLI checkout isn't compatible with the default tax calculation.
NOTE To apply other price adjustments, extend the default ccrz.ccLogicCartPrice logic service provider and invoke your extension.

To manage the fees and charges shown in the Order Review section of the Checkout page:

Specify whether the Checkout page calculates and shows tax and shipping costs.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select General (2).
Scroll to the Storefront Flags section, and find the Skip Tax Calculation option (3).
To disable tax calculation for the entire storefront, enable Skip Tax Calculation.
To enable tax calculation for the storefront by default and show calculated tax on the Checkout page, leave Skip Tax Calculation disabled.
NOTE When tax calculation is enabled by default, you can still disable tax calculation for a specific product or account.
Find the Skip Shipping Calculation option (4).
To ignore shipping costs on the Order Review section of the Checkout page, enable Skip Shipping Calculation.
To enable shipping cost calculation and show the estimated shipping on the Checkout page, leave Skip Shipping Calculation disabled.
Scroll back to the top and click Save (5).
To show the surcharge line item, update your storefront configuration settings.
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (6).
From the Module picklist, select Order Review (7).
Find the Show Total Surcharge configuration (8), and make sure that its value is TRUE (9).
NOTE Another configuration with a similar name, Show Surcharge, appears under the Order Review module. However, this configuration is deprecated, and no longer controls any functionality by default.
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Order Review
Configuration	Show Total Surcharge
Page	all
Value	TRUE
Verify that version 2.0 of the Order Review section of the Checkout page isn't invoking legacy price adjustment API.
From the Module picklist, select Checkout (10).
Find the Skip Price Adjustment configuration (11), and make sure that its value is TRUE (12).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Checkout
Configuration	Skip Price Adjustment
Page	all
Value	TRUE
IMPORTANT This configuration can be FALSE only when you're using the Shopping Cart page version 1.0. When this configuration is FALSE, the Order Review section of the Checkout page calls the non-global ccrz.cc_api_PriceAdjustment.setDiscount method of the B2B Commerce for Visualforce API for adjusting prices.
Build and activate a new configuration cache.
